name: Cream of Cauliflower Soup With Bacon Gremolata
author: Chef John
summary: We're heading into the heart of hot soup season, and this cream of cauliflower will ward off autumn's chill with the best of them.
ingredients: 1 large russet potato, peeled and quartered
2 heads   cauliflower, cored and separated into florets
1 pinch cayenne pepper, or more to taste
directions: Heat olive oil in a saucepan over medium heat
Cook and stir onion and celery in the hot oil until translucent, about 5 minutes
Add garlic and salt, and stir for 1 minute
Stir in potato, cauliflower, chicken broth, and water
Bring to a boil, reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until cauliflower is tender and potatoes are easily smashed against the side of the pot, about 30 minutes
Puree the soup using an immersion blender until smooth
Reduce heat to low, season with cayenne pepper and salt
Pour in cream and stir until warmed
Season with more salt if needed
Cook bacon in a skillet over medium heat until crisp, about 8 minutes
Transfer cooked bacon to a paper towel lined plate to drain
Toss breadcrumbs in the remaining bacon grease in the skillet, and cook over low heat until toasted and crisp
Stir in cheese and continue to cook until melted
Transfer to a bowl and cool to room temperature
Stir in bacon, lemon zest, and parsley
Serve soup garnished with bacon gremolata over the top
